toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText:
Defines the method of MRP supply calculation for item, working in conjunction with MRP Planning Policy. 

Lot for Lot - Qty must = 1 
Days Cover - Number of days that supply is to cover 
Reorder Point Qty - Order qty when OH + supplies < Safety Stock

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText:
Denotes if item is backflushed (auto-issued) upon a WO or Subcontract PO Receipt, and if on a WO, at what stage the backflush will occur. Values are 

•	No Backflushing
•	First Operation
•	Last Operation
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Backflush Policy
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__icitem_backflushpol__c
toolingEntityParticle.Metadata: <CustomField xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata" > <fullName>rstk__icitem__c.rstk__icitem_backflushpol__c</fullName> <caseSensitive>false</caseSensitive> <deprecated>false</deprecated> <description>This Type is an indicator identifying whether items assigned to this commodity code can be back flushed. Selection options are No back flushing. The items assigned to this commodity code are not back flushed from inventory to the work order. First operation. Items assigned to this commodity code are back flushed from inventory to the work order when Work Order Operation Quantity Bookings are processed for the first operation in the routing. If this item is to be issued to an operation , then the actual ‘backflush’ will occur at the operation that is designated on the Work Order Demand (which was derived from the work center and process information on the PEBOMOVR record). Last operation. Items assigned to this commodity code are back flushed from inventory to the work order when Work Order Operation Quantity Bookings are processed for the last operation in the routing as the assembly is being received into stock. (DD)</description> <escapeMarkup>false</escapeMarkup> <externalId>false</externalId> <inlineHelpText>Denotes if item is backflushed (auto-issued) upon a WO or Subcontract PO Receipt, and if on a WO, at what stage the backflush will occur. toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: If using Centralized Engineering, this is the Division under which Eng Items, BOMs, Revisions and Change Orders are created and maintained.
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Engineering Division
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__icitem_engdivovr__c
toolingEntityParticle.Metadata: <CustomField xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata" > <fullName>rstk__icitem__c.rstk__icitem_engdivovr__c</fullName> <caseSensitive>false</caseSensitive> <deleteConstraint>SetNull</deleteConstraint> <deprecated>false</deprecated> <description>Refer to DIVISION (in Common Fields/Concepts) Refer to MULTI DIVISION CONSIDERATIONS (in Common Fields/Concepts) In a single division environment, the Engineering Division (PEITEM_DIV) is equal to the Inventory Division (ICITEM_DIV). In a multi division environment, there are multiple Inventory Divisions. In the situation of multiple Inventory Divisions at the most one may have the same Division as Engineering For those that do not, there is a requirement to refer to the Engineering Division and the purpose of this field is to set the value to that Centralized Engineering Division for reference. In a single division environment or in a multi division environment that does not have a centralized engineering capability, this field is set to null and is not used. This is only used in those multi division environments where there is a centralized engineering division and then this ICITEM_ENGDIVOVR is set to the SYCMP_ENGDIV. (DD)</description> <escapeMarkup>false</escapeMarkup> <externalId>false</externalId> <inlineHelpText>If using Centralized Engineering, this is the Division under which Eng Items, BOMs, Revisions and Change Orders are created and maintained.</inlineHelpText> <isAIPredictionField>false</isAIPredictionField> <isConvertLeadDisabled>false</isConvertLeadDisabled> <isFilteringDisabled>false</isFilteringDisabled> <isNameField>false</isNameField> <isSortingDisabled>false</isSortingDisabled> <label>Engineering Division</label> <length>0</length> <populateExistingRows>false</populateExistingRows> <precision>0</precision> <referenceTo>rstk__sydiv__c</referenceTo> <relationshipLabel>Inventory Item Master (Engineering Division)</relationshipLabel> <relationshipName>ICITEMs1</relationshipName> <relationshipOrder>0</relationshipOrder> <reparentableMasterDetail>false</reparentableMasterDetail> <required>false</required> <restrictedAdminField>false</restrictedAdminField> <scale>0</scale> <startingNumber>0</startingNumber> <stripMarkup>false</stripMarkup> <trackFeedHistory>false</trackFeedHistory> <trackHistory>false</trackHistory> <trackTrending>false</trackTrending> <translateData>false</translateData> <type>Lookup</type> <unique>false</unique> <visibleLines>0</visibleLines> <writeRequiresMasterRead>false</writeRequiresMasterRead></CustomField>

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: This value represents the maximum supply quantity planned by MRP. The MRP will never plan an order in excess of this quantity, with the exception of a value of 0, which is considered as "no maximum".
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Maximum Quantity
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__icitem_mrpmaxqty__c

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: This value represents the maximum supply quantity planned by MRP. The MRP will never plan an order in excess of this quantity, with the exception of a value of 0, which is considered as "no maximum".
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Maximum Quantity Ind
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__icitem_mrpmaxqtyind__c

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: This value is the min qty for which MRP will plan an order. If set to 8 and the demand is 4, the order will be the min qty of 8. When the demand is greater than the min the actual demand qty is planned, so if the demand is for 12, the order will be 12.
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Minimum Quantity
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__icitem_mrpminqty__c

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: This value is the min qty for which MRP will plan an order. If set to 8 and the demand is 4, the order will be the min qty of 8. When the demand is greater than the min the actual demand qty is planned, so if the demand is for 12, the order will be 12.
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Minimum Quantity Ind
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__icitem_mrpminqtyind__c

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText:
Defines how MRP will plan item. Values are - 

No MRP Planning (Not planned by MRP) 
Days Cover (Group together all demands within the # of days defined) 
Lot for Lot (Plan supply for each demand) 
Reorder Point (Order Policy Qty when < Safety Stock)
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Planning Policy
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__icitem_mrpplanpol__c

When ICITEM_MRPPLANPOL set to Days Cover, this value is expressed in days. When ICITEM_MRPPLANPOL set to Lot for Lot, this value is set to 1. toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText:
Defines how MRP will plan item. Values are -

No MRP Planning (Not planned by MRP)
Days Cover (Group together all demands within the # of days defined)
Lot for Lot (Plan a supply for each demand)
Reorder Point (Order Policy Qty when < Safety Stock)
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Planning Policy Ind
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__icitem_mrpplanpolind__c

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText:
Defines the method of MRP supply calculation for item, working in conjunction with MRP Planning Policy.

Lot for Lot - Qty must = 1
Days Cover - Number of days that supply is to cover
Reorder Point Qty - Order qty when OH + supplies < Safety Stock
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Policy Quantity
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__icitem_mrppolqty__c

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText:
Defines the method of MRP supply calculation for item, working in conjunction with MRP Planning Policy. 

Lot for Lot - Qty must = 1 
Days Cover - Number of days that supply is to cover 
Reorder Point Qty - Order qty when OH + supplies < Safety Stock
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Policy Quantity Ind
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__icitem_mrppolqtyind__c

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: Indicates the source of the item in the given Division. Selections are Manufactured (made in-house), Purchased (obtained from a Vendor) or Subcontract (produced by a Vendor using Items supplied from in-house inventory).
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Source
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__icitem_src_pl__c
toolingEntityParticle.Metadata: <CustomField xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata" > <fullName>rstk__icitem__c.rstk__icitem_src_pl__c</fullName> <caseSensitive>false</caseSensitive> <deprecated>false</deprecated> <description>Inventory sources are: PURCHASED Purchased items are purchased via a PO and received into inventory with an Item Receipt operation. MANUFACTURED Manufactured items are manufactured “in house” and received into inventory with a WO receipt operation. SUBCONTRACT Subcontract items are purchased from an outside vendor and some or all of the component items, as defined by the BOM, may be supplied from inventory to that subcontract vendor.). MRP in creating supplies will refer to the source code and create supplies as follows: Work Orders (if the ICITEM_SRC = ‘M’) Purchase Requisitions (if the ICITEM_SRC = ‘P’) Subcontract Purchase Requisitions (if the ICITEM_SRC = ‘S’) If this is a FIFO costed item (PEITEM_FIFOIND = ‘T’), the ICITEM_SRC must be ‘P’ (Purchased). (DD)</description> <escapeMarkup>false</escapeMarkup> <externalId>false</externalId> <inlineHelpText>Indicates the source of the item in the given Division.
